etymology.description: semantic: 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") + phonetic: 莫(莫) (mò) = sound and sense -> difficult
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird"), suggesting something small or elusive, with 莫(莫) (mò) for its phonetic contribution. Together, they evoke a sense of difficulty or challenge.

examples.chinese: 这道题太难(這道題太難)。
考试不容易(考試不容易)，却很难掌握(卻很難掌握)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎoshì bù róngyì, què hěn nán zhǎngwò.
examples.english: Exams are not easy, yet they are difficult to master.
